entry.title: Am I Missing Something?
entry.summary:
Author: mikaminato

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,023Chapters: 1/2Kudos: 17

Summary: Clark pulls back, sitting on the edge of the computer's control panel. He runs his hands through his hair. "I think Dick doesn't approve of us," he blurts out, feeling ridiculous as he says it."Dick?" Bruce arches a brow, looking up at Clark, a flash of surprise flickering in his eyes. "Why would you think that?""Just a hunch." Clark shrugs. "And tonight I feel like he was kind of cold to me? I'm not used to that, I admit it. I've known Dick for so many years now, but it felt like he was… avoiding me?" (Or, Clark thinks Dick doesn't approve of his relationship with Bruce. But the truth is, Dick is just really bad a communicating and stupidly jealous.)

entry.title: False Front
entry.summary:
Author: SavioroftheStars

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 154,430Chapters: 17/?Kudos: 439

Summary: Dick Grayson is an undercover agent, tasked with infiltrating the Red Hoods, a dangerous new gang with a strict code of ethics. Posing as Ricky Kelly, a former sex worker with a fabricated past, Dick is sent to gain the trust of their leader, the mysterious and unpredictable Red Hood. As he works his way deeper into the gang, Dick quickly realizes that the Red Hoods are unlike any other criminal organization he’s encountered—disciplined, strategic, and governed by a unique moral code.But things become complicated when Dick finds himself developing feelings for their enigmatic leader and growing closer with the people he was sent to deceive.

entry.title: You Are Out of My League
entry.summary:
Author: ivebeenbamboozled (brainwitchletty)

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 348,965Chapters: 36/?Kudos: 985

Summary: The story begins with a new Robin to replace the old, with Nightwing none the wiser to being replaced at all, and suddenly he has a little brother within the same terrible day. It takes a while to accept, but Dick quickly learns this new Robin-- Jason Todd-- is exactly what Dick Grayson was always missing in his life, and in many more ways than one. Through the years with the team and working with the Justice League, Jason finds a place for himself and becomes a vital member of the Young Justice League while also becoming a vital centerpiece in Dick's life. And when all that ends-- when Jason Todd is taken away from Dick-- it's going to be even harder to put his life back together with that emptiness returning once more.. . .Mostly canon compliant story detailing Jason's introduction to the Young Justice League as Robin, his eventual death, and Dick discovering the mysterious red-hooded figure acting as Ra's Al Ghul's bodyguard is a lot more familiar than he should be.

entry.title: A Series of Bat Events
entry.summary:
Author: ToriaFiction

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,532Chapters: 4/4Kudos: 113

Summary: A collection of one shots. Each chapter is a complete work.Chapter 1: Cass Plays Cupid 💘Sometimes, silly boys need a helpful push in the right direction.Chapter 2: Joker Murdered ☠️It's not that anyone cares that the Joker was murdered. The issue is that they can't figure it out. That someone out there is so good that they didn't leave a single trace behind. It's the fact that someone out there is better than the Bats.Chapter 3: Fae Bound ✨️If he ever meets whoever he inherited his magic from, he won't thank them. You never thank a fae; that is admitting that they have done something for you and puts you in their debt.Chapter 4:🌘 Black Brotherhood 🌑Dick manipulates the shadows, and the darkness becomes silk in his hands. He wraps the fabric around Jason's eyes and tells him to wait there for him. Then, he starts his own massacre.

entry.title: performing, or living
entry.summary:
Author: chasm_side

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 24,078Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 109

Summary: "Everyone tells themselves little stories about who they are," she told him. "Stories about why they do what they do, why they want what they want. And that's fine—telling a story isn't the same as telling a lie, you know?" "Sure," Dick agreed. "It only gets fucked up when you start thinking your story is the only story worth believing," Jay said. "That you've got some kind of monopoly on truth, that you're the only person who gets to tell other people what's really real. So… if you let me have my little stories, I'll let you have yours. If you need to believe in Batman, if you need Bruce to be a good father, if you need to roll around in your shame about not being honest with Daddy about all the awesome sex you're having with the most problematic of Daddy's problem children—I mean, sure, whatever gets you off, right?" Dick Grayson navigates the line between fantasy and reality, tries to be a better man, has increasingly kinky sex with his pseudo-sister, and refuses to have a crisis about any of it. Jay's taking everything in stride, so why shouldn't Dick learn to accept a little volatility in his civilian life? It's only as Nightwing that he has to care about control.
